node.description: The sweet aroma of pipe tobacco and rum drifts into the area from somewhere beyond the battle-scarred walls of Raven's Point, carried upon the bitter cold mountain air that swirls about the crystalline valley. Several rows of icicles cling to the sharpened peaks of the rough-cut walls, trembling slightly as the fur-clad guards stomp along their patrols with military precision.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Crystalline Gorge
node.description: The frigid bite of the mountain wind sweeps though the valley, filling the air with a gentle hum as it vibrates the curious crystal-like ice formations. Several caravan tracks are worn into the rock of the valley floor from countless years of supply deliveries to the outpost of Raven's Point. Twisted rock monoliths, entombed within a thick layer of black ice, protrude from the ground at haphazard angles along the valley floor.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Collapsed Tunnel
node.description: The remnants of a tunnel cut into the western wall lies strewn about the ground, having been obviously closed to seal something within the black rock. Several S'Kra Mur skeletons dressed in rusted suits of plate armor lie trapped beneath the fallen remains of the tunnel, their talons worn down to nubs as they attempted to claw through the hard stone. Wrought iron lanterns have been hastily hammered into the walls around the rubble, bathing the area in a pallid yellow light.

node.name: Raven's Point, North Gate
node.description: Houses here were constructed nearly atop of one another and lean sideways at odd angles, looking as if they could topple over in the slightest breeze. Groups of people dressed in layers of thick fur shuffle along the cramped streets, careful to avoid the occasional overloaded caravan delivering supplies though the north gate. Thick clouds of black smoke bellow from the sagging chimneys that protrude from the roofs of the numerous homes within the outpost, filling the air with sharp smell of burning wood.

node.name: Raven's Point, Town Square
node.description: Towering above the other ramshackle buildings of the outpost is the commerce center, serving as the hub that the wheel of life in Raven's Point revolves around. Rows upon rows of uneven granite tiles have been arranged in a circular pattern in the center of the square, encircling the massive stone monument placed in the center. Four large pillars marking the cardinal directions are hung with numerous deep blue icicle-shaped wind chimes, filling the square with the delicate sound of singing crystal.

node.name: Raven's Point, Northern Square
node.description: An elaborate chapel rises above the crooked homes of Raven's Point, its candlelit mikkhalbamar archway bathing the towering facade in a pale yellow glow. Rows of icicles dangle from the overhanging roofs of the houses that surround the rectangular square, glittering dangerously within the cloak of night. The frigid mountain air is filled with the lingering scent of smoldering wood, as the remnants of the last days cooking fires slowly burn themselves out.

An elaborate chapel rises above the crooked homes of Raven's Point, its mikkhalbamar archway welcoming all who seek solace and comfort upon its sanctified ground. Rows of icicles dangle from the overhanging roofs of the houses that surround the rectangular square, glittering dangerously in the available light. The air is filled with the lingering scent of fresh cooking and the sharp thud of boots as they strike the icy cobbles inset into the ground.

node.name: Raven's Point, Gear Gate
node.description: The massive gear gate is a flurry of constant motion as war-worn generals dressed in bulky suits of ornamental armor bark orders at the legions of soldiers, prepared to defend the outpost at a moment's notice. Countless Forfedhdarian archers stationed on the towers keep a careful watch on the southern pass. A squat stone building with a sturdy door covered in pelts rests amidst the ramshackle hovels, its double-wide red brick chimney spouting a curling pillar of inky black smoke.

node.name: Raven's Point, Western Square
node.description: The weathered log walls that enclose the outpost curve inward sharply around the narrow walkway that winds between ramshackle homes, pressing nearly flush against the weathered stone of the canyon. High above, the silhouetted figures of the guards on patrol sweep back and forth along the top of the walls, scanning the distance for invading forces. Within the shadow of an overhanging ledge the entrance to a cavern splits the uneven stone of the western wall.

node.name: Raven's Point, Collapsed Tunnel
node.description: A wide path has been cut though the maze of stalagmites, winding along the cold cobblestone floor to halt before the collapsed remnants of a massive archway. The intricately carved surface of the stone has been sundered savagely from the jagged walls of the cavern, taking with it a large amount of the surrounding stone. Two burly Dwarven guards clad in impressive suits of gem-encrusted armor hold a constant vigil, keeping careful watch for approaching intruders.

node.name: Raven's Point, Training Yard
node.description: The air is filled with the sound of clashing swords as tenderfoot and veteran alike hone their skills on the equipment arranged around the training yard. A massive barracks protrudes from the face of the sheer rock wall, its reinforced structure equipped with several ballistas and onagers. Each one is manned by a group of heavily armored archers and guards. High above, a massive twisted horn rests upon a ledge, used to warn the outpost's citizens to run for cover in time of siege by invading forces.

node.name: The Raven's Nest, Entry Hall
node.description: Formed from what was once an expansive cave, the room is dominated by glistening stalactites hung with iron-wrought lanterns that dangle downward from the ceiling. Elegant arches carved with worn symbols support the black stone overhead, crossing paths at the pinnacle of the triangular room. Numerous Dwarven soldiers stride purposefully along the polished black stone floor, spreading outward to their unknown destinations.

node.name: The Raven's Nest, Great Hall
node.description: Slightly more narrow then the entry, the great hall has been decorated with fur that lines the polished floor, resting beneath the banners dangling from the stalactites overhead. Softly flickering orbs dangle from the rock ceiling overhead, bathing the expansive hall in a pale yellow light. A thick mikkhalbamar door, flanked by two burly Dwarven guards, leads into the commander's office.

node.name: The Raven's Nest, Dormitory
node.description: Narrow passages cut through the stone of the dormitory twist away out of sight, giving glimpses of doorway upon doorway. Muffled sounds trickle from behind the squat opening, echoing along the passage. Small pools of water have collected in narrow grooves worn into the stone floor, casting rippling beams of light upon the black stone walls.

node.name: The Raven's Nest, Dormitory
node.description: Dust-covered tapestries are hung from the walls between the unending row of doorways set into the walls of the dark stone passage. Stomping to and from their assigned dwellings, residents show signs of extreme fatigue and stress across their weatherworn visages.

node.name: The Raven's Nest, Dormitory
node.description: The sound of running water fills the narrow chamber, emanating from a shallow stone fountain carved into the eastern wall around a natural spring of icy mountain water. The numerous doorways that fill the dormitory follow the sharp curve of the passage, basking in the dull glow of several torches set midway up the walls on either side.

node.name: The Raven's Nest, Dormitory
node.description: A few elaborate suits of ancient armor rest in the unadorned sections between the closely set doorways, their polished silver surfaces shimmering softly in the torchlight. Steel planks bridge a jagged crack in the stone floor below, revealing a narrow gorge that descends into shadows far below.

node.name: The Raven's Nest, Mess Hall
node.description: Brightly illuminated, the hall is filled with the sounds of clattering dishes, groaning screeches of benches upon the polished stone floor and the low rumble of muttered speech, all combining to form a whirlwind of sound. Along the eastern wall, a long rack displays a selection of food heavily picked over by the masses of warriors that come and go from the mess hall. Tightly packed rows of tables make it difficult to keep up with the mess left behind.

node.name: Smoky Bandit's, Shop
node.description: Pungent to extraordinarily sweet, the heavy aroma of tobacco of all kinds assails the senses in this small, cramped room. Shelves lined with dusty glass jars of varying translucency vie for space with hooks hung with pouches, and tiered tables display handmade pipes. Centered on the back wall is a large portrait of an extremely aged Dwarven man with a long pipe dangling from his mouth.

node.name: Smoky Bandit's, Lounge
node.description: Rocking chairs and couches with rock-hard cushions are arranged in a semicircle around a large fireplace, above which is a detailed mosaic landscape done in a variety of rough native stone. A snowbeast pelt rug is spread in the center of the space, a squat stone table atop it holding refreshments for customers to enjoy while puffing on their pipes. The stale scent of tobacco clings to every surface despite the cloudy glass window kept open a small crack for ventilation.

node.name: Bank of Raven's Point, Lobby
node.description: Incredibly thick slabs of stone form this bank, the sheer impenetrability giving the impression that the building was carved from an outcropping of stone at the center of the town. There is no decoration here, just low bronze braziers which illuminate the room and stain the walls with their soot. The doorway of the bank itself is open, though a massive stone cleverly designed to roll into place rests beside it. Several ornery-looking guards armed with enormous battle axes stand at the ready.

node.name: Bank of Raven's Point, Exchange
node.description: A small square hole is cut into the stone wall, leaving just enough room to speak to the clerk behind it and to slide coins back and forth -- security is no joke at this bank. The only break in the monotony of the grey stone walls is a plain exchange rate board and a small calendar set into the wall.

node.name: Bank of Raven's Point, Depository
node.description: Chiseled into the cold stone walls of the bank is a tiny opening which leaves just enough room for the teller behind it to squint through and pass coins. The flat grey of the room is unbroken, save for a few pale scuffs and a streak of old blood on the thick wall nearest the lobby.

node.name: Jeol'gelvmoraen, Frozen Tunnel
node.description: Carved into the icy stone, an expansive cavern winds its way downward into glimmering shadows far below. Broken bones are casually stacked against the slanted walls, the space between each pile cutting a narrow pathway down the midline of the dank chamber. The craggy fissure that splits the southern wall offers an obstructed view of the mountains beyond, the pristine snow catching the light, its pale blanket smoothing the harsh lines of the mountain's visage.

Carved into the icy stone, an expansive cavern winds its way downward into glimmering shadows far below. Piles of broken bones are casually pushed against the slanted cavern walls, the space between them cutting a narrow pathway down the midline of the dank passage. Gentle beams of flickering light dance across the slanted stone floor, streaming through the craggy fissure that leads to the jagged mountainside beyond.

node.name: Jeol'gelvmoraen, Ice Grottos
node.description: Lined in an immense layer of ice, the cavern expands outward into chamber after endless chamber. Stalactites, nearly three times the height of a mature Gor'Tog, stretch from ceiling to floor like glassy assassin's daggers, threatening to fall at a moment's notice. Along the northeastern wall, a curving stone passage rises upward at a steep angle, partially bathed in a pale illumination cast from some unknown source.

node.name: Jeol'gelvmoraen, Ice Grottos
node.description: Cloudy drops of mineral-rich water cling to the stalactites lining the ceiling as if fighting for their very survival. In the end, the battle is always lost, and the droplets plummet to the cavern floor. Massive claws have raked the wall, leaving behind deep gouges. A narrow man-made crevice cuts through the luminescent pale blue ice, allowing passage to those brave enough to squeeze though the tight space.

node.name: Jeol'gelvmoraen, Ice Grottos
node.description: The expansive pale blue passage of glittering ice seems to stretch on forever, as if viewed from within the heart of a faceted diamond. Like the inner fire of a gem, a luster refracts from the polished surface of the ice, bathing the area in a shifting hue of color. Small bits of fabric, bone, and frost-covered wood fill the deep crevices of ice that wind around the cavern, the sign someone or something inhabits this seemingly barren cavern.

node.name: Jeol'gelvmoraen, Ice Grottos
node.description: As though carved from a single frozen mass, pillars of glass-like ice trail from ceiling to floor in tight groups. Every step and sound fills the air with sharp echoes as even the minutest sound reverberates around the cavern's expanse, tripling in strength before dying off into uneasy silence. A few spear-like tips of rock thrust out from the icy walls, glimmering softly in the available light.

node.name: Jeol'gelvmoraen, Ice Grottos
node.description: Shifting beams of light filter through a partially obstructed opening that splits the pinnacle of the ceiling, causing the surrounding walls to glisten like a freshly cut diamond. Snow-dusted icicles hang between rough patches of stone that protrude from the foot of the gap, stretching down the faceted walls to just above the floor.

Shifting beams of dancing sunlight filter in though a partially obstructed opening that splits the pinnacle of the ceiling, causing the surrounding walls to glisten like a freshly cut diamond. Snow-dusted icicles hang between the rough patches of stone that protrude from the foot of the gap, stretching down the faceted walls almost to the floor.

node.name: Jeol'gelvmoraen, Ice Grottos
node.description: Curiously mummified creatures, contorted into odd postures by the slow movement of the ice, rest beneath the surface of the walls and floor. Their baleful eyes gaze blankly from behind the faceted flow, almost pleading for release from their frigid tombs. A tracery of faint cracks emanates from beneath a twisted stone that has fallen from the ceiling an oval of tortuous white imperfections marks the collision, stark upon a sea of blue ice.

node.name: Jeol'gelvmoraen, Ice Grottos
node.description: Like a maze of mirrors, the crystal-clear surfaces of the ice reflect the distorted images of those who have found themselves within its icy walls. Along the northern wall, the frozen cascade of a waterfall captured in a single moment in time spills from the ceiling down into a pool of jagged ice and stone. The faint aroma of musk mingles with the chill scent of stale water, tickling the senses as it drifts about the expansive grotto.

node.name: Jeol'gelvmoraen, Ice Grottos
node.description: Countless niches, cut into the otherwise smooth surface of the shimmering pale blue ice, reach up to the stalactite-lined ceiling. Several matted white pelts, each bearing large and unsightly stains, rest atop thick beds of straw and decayed plant matter that line the frozen floor of each niche. Small shards of white bone and tattered bits of armor have been neatly piled near a frozen basin dug into the ground, surrounded in a liberal dusting of fine black ash.

node.name: Haalikshal Highway, Stember's Ford
node.description: A shallow ford crosses a small stream running north down the valley. A wide road leads from it to Sang Munar, the entrance to the tunnel beneath the eastern mountains. To the northwest, the road crosses the valley to the foot of the western mountain range.

node.name: Haalikshal Highway, The Sky Road
node.description: A high valley spotted with wildflowers lies between two lines of mountain peaks. Across a ford to the southeast, the entrance to the underground highway beckons, but the view to the northwest awes rather than welcomes: a road twists and bends up the western range, switching back and forth and looking impossibly steep. As it dwindles from sight, high and far away, one can understand why it's called The Sky Road.

node.name: Haalikshal Highway, The Sky Road
node.description: The road lies along the side of the western range, passing from sight at times as it follows the contours of the hillside.

node.name: Haalikshal Highway, The Sky Road
node.description: The highway takes a sharp bend, turning in a sweeping curve along the almost vertical wall of the mountainside. A landslide in the past must have torn the road from its former path, requiring the hard labor of cutting away the hillside to reroute the road around the gap.

node.name: Haalikshal Highway, The Sky Road
node.description: At one spot along the way, nature has provided one of her surprises -- fractures in the rock have divided the cliff wall into several nearly equal panels with smooth surfaces. And passersby have taken advantage of the oddity to use the panels as their tablets on which to address the world.

node.name: Haalikshal Highway, The Sky Road
node.description: A rocky spur thrusts out from the face of the western range, and the road bends sharply around it, commanding sweeping views to the north, east, and south. At the valley side of the highway stands a telescope in a small paved area with a stone parapet.

node.name: Haalikshal Highway, The Sky Road
node.description: For a stretch of several hundred yards the road widens, taking advantage of a natural ledge. The area offers unobstructed views of the roadway for a good distance up and down the slope, and the level ground allows caravans or wagons going in opposite directions to pass in safety.

node.name: Haalikshal Highway, The Sky Road
node.description: A spate of water roars down the mountainside with deafening noise and drenching mist, rushing under a stone bridge that carries the road across its path. A high brick parapet on the side toward the cataract screens the roadbed from the worst of the spray.

node.name: Haalikshal Highway, The Sky Road
node.description: Nearing the summit, the road traverses its steepest grade in its passage along the mountainside. A stone parapet lines the valley side of the roadway, giving warning and some protection against a misstep. Iron eyebolts have been driven into the cliff face, spaced about a furlong apart, for wagons that need to be secured while the team is changed or repairs are made.

node.name: Haalikshal Highway, The Sky Road
node.description: A short distance up the hill, torches light a wooden gate in a stone wall. In the other direction, to the southeast, a wide, graveled road descends into the darkness of the valley below.

This spot just below the summit of the ridge commands sweeping views to the north, where a broad river runs far below, and to the east and southeast, where another range fills the horizon. A short distance up the hill is a gate in a stone wall to the southeast, the road skirts the side of the western range to the valley far below.

node.name: Lewkar Awg, The Courtyard
node.description: Lanterns light a round tower in a small cobblestone courtyard. Their flickering beams reflect off the water in a trough and off a brass-studded door in the tower. In the east and west walls are gates made of stout timbers.

A small cobblestone courtyard serves travelers as a place for a short rest, offering a water trough for the animals and benches out of the wind for their riders. In the east and west walls are gates made of stout timbers strapped with brass. A few stone steps lead up to the door of the round tower in the center of the yard.

node.name: Haalikshal Highway, The Sky Road
node.description: The lights of a distant settlement dot the darkness to the southwest. To the northeast, flickering torches flank a gate in a wall at the crest of the hill. Behind the wall, a tower is dimly visible.

To the southwest, the steep but wide road rises from a distant valley, climbing to a gate in a stone wall to the northeast. Behind the wall, a grey tower three or four stories high dominates the skyline.

node.name: Lewkar Awg, The Reception Room
node.description: The round and rather spacious reception room occupies the whole ground floor of the tower. A copper kettle hangs from a bracket over the fireplace. A rough desk sits by the fire, and a few benches provide seating near a passage to the north. The only other furnishing is a handsome welcome mat near the entrance door.

node.name: Lewkar Awg, The Tower Barracks
node.description: It's good that the room is big, because either each guard supplied his own bedding or the barracks was equipped from a used furniture sale. Every kind of resting place except a grave seems represented, among them a four-poster bed, a brass bed, a frame-and-canvas cot, a threadbare couch, a hammock hung from the ceiling, and a straw tick on the floor.

node.name: Lewkar Awg, The Tower Watchroom
node.description: Barred windows at the eight cardinal points of the compass pierce the stone walls of this round, empty room. From here, guards can watch the comings and goings to and from Hibarnhvidar in every direction. To aid the absent-minded or forgetful, the arms of a compass rose set in the floor stretch to the corresponding windows.

node.name: Lewkar Awg, The Tower Kitchen
node.description: The kitchen looks functional, with a table and bench, a big storage cabinet for supplies, and even a crate of bread ready for use. An iron stove stands on one side, its pipe running out through the wall. A pot is bubbling away on the hot stove, and a coal scuttle sits alongside.

node.name: Haalikshal Highway, Ferry Dock
node.description: An ample dock lies in an elbow of the river, and to its stones is fastened the stout chain that guides the ferry. Although many a fisherman would like to tie his punt or rowboat here, the ferrymen fend them off, warning them against fouling the tow-line or, with more urgency, against getting caught between the heavy timbers of the ferry and the stones of the dock.

node.name: Cragstone Vale, Roadway
node.description: The road hugs the river, culminating in a bridge that once spanned the flow, leading to the mouth of the valley. Scorched, scarred earthworks are all that now remain of a long abandoned fortification. The great rents in the defenses must have been torn by a devastating force, exposing a massive shard of black rock resting at its heart.

node.name: Commerce Center, Entryway
node.description: Matted and worn from the stomp of heavy boots, a large rug of unidentifiable brown fur covers the floor of the foyer. Braziers billow heat from the corners of the room, set to warm the three main sections of the commerce hub of Raven's Point: the furrier to the west, the general store to the north, and the gembuyer to the east.

node.name: Stedh's Furs
node.description: Dominated by a long stone counter, this small room is filled with the heavy scent of the partially preserved pelts and hides that hang on every surface of the walls. A dirty window overlooks the town square of the tiny village. The shop's burly owner, Stedh, keeps the store in a barely controlled state of disarray -- though only between flirting with every lass who walks through his door.

node.name: Gimsta's Gimstaan
node.description: Glass baubles in rich jewel tones hang before a glistening window that faces the street, the faux gems catching and refracting the sunlight into a rainbow of colors. A thick white fur rug lies in front of a polished stone counter behind which is a cushioned stool and a golden loupe hung on a small hook. Brocade tapestries of Forfedhdarian landscapes cover the walls, their brilliant hues and refined appearance a rarity in this cold mountain village.

node.name: General Store
node.description: Hardly more than a handful of miscellaneous supplies, the general store of Raven's Point is a hub of activity for visiting hunters, warriors, and miners. A pitted bronze weapon rack takes up most of the display wall, the gleaming armaments hung above a long stone table.

node.name: Himineldar Shel, Along the Trail
node.description: A broken, ivy-covered dry stone wall can be seen alongside the trail in this small natural clearing. Lines of pine trees encircle the last vestiges of grass and wildly growing flowers of what used to be a garden. Beyond the wall the sun gleams off a small pond surrounded by tall reeds.
An occasional soft splash is heard in the darkness beyond a wall that runs alongside the trail.

node.name: Himineldar Shel, Trail's End
node.description: As the trail abruptly leaves the wooded area, a large cracked boulder almost completely blocks the path. In the distance, the winds and weather have left only the hardiest of pines and shrubs on this face of the mountain.
As the trail abruptly leaves the wooded area, a large cracked boulder almost completely blocks the path. In the distance, the face of the mountain rises up out of the darkness.

node.name: On the Mountainside, Stony Trail
node.description: Stones underfoot make traversing the trail precarious, as every step dislodges bits of rubble to send them skittering down the path. On one side of the trail, scrub and sturdy pines cling tenaciously to the boulders that jut out of the mountainside. On the other is air, though a fall here would deal little damage.

Stones underfoot make traversing the trail precarious, as every step dislodges bits of rubble to bounce away into the darkness. On one side of the trail, scrub and sturdy pines cling tenaciously to the boulders that jut out from the mountainside. On the other is air, though a fall here would deal little damage.

node.name: On the Mountainside, Cleared Flat
node.description: Three tall stone slabs, one resting across the other two, form a convenient bench -- for someone about three times as tall as a 'Tog, perhaps. The ground around the boulders is bare of the rocks strewn along the rest of the trail, as if scuffed away.

node.name: On the Mountainside, High Trail
node.description: Though wide enough to hold several hikers walking abreast, the trail falls sharply off to the west. Shifting rubble underfoot forces travelers to clutch at the branches of stunted pines, leaving bits of bark and broken brown needles to litter the ground. A large crevice can be seen in the distance halfway to the summit.

Though wide enough to hold several hikers walking abreast, the trail falls sharply off to the west. Shifting rubble underfoot forces travelers to clutch at the branches of stunted pines, leaving bits of bark and broken brown needles to litter the ground. An occasional faint glow can be seen sometimes in the darkness halfway up the summit.

node.name: On the Mountainside, Plateau
node.description: The ground levels out and widens here, providing a safe area to rest before the challenging trail ahead. A large depression in the ground has collected water from the last rainfall. Droppings and paw prints impressed in the muddy surface around the pool mark this as a watering hole for local animals.

The ground levels out and widens here, providing a safe area to rest. A large depression in the ground has collected water from the last rainfall. Skittering in the darkness is evidence of wildlife that might use this as a watering hole.

node.name: On the Mountainside, Rock Face
node.description: The trail narrows, forcing travelers to edge carefully along the overhanging rock face to avoid a painful fall. Looking down, all that can be seen is a dauntingly long stretch of open air between you and the broken boulders and pale bones littering the bottom of the slope.

The trail narrows, forcing travelers to edge carefully along the overhanging rock face to avoid a painful fall. Nothing can be seen in the darkness below, but the occasional rock that is dislodged seems to take forever before hitting solid ground.

node.name: On the Mountainside, The Flat
node.description: A large firepit filled with muddy ashes is in the center of what is clearly a campsite. From this vantage point a crevice further up the trail can be seen.

node.name: On the Mountainside, The Trail
node.description: The trail is devoid of any real hazards to your footing -- a good thing, as a fall from this spot would surely be deadly. Small figures and wagons move along the road far below, while an occasional hawk or eagle soars near the summit.

The trail is devoid of any real hazards to your footing -- a good thing, as a fall from this spot would surely be deadly. From time to time, something rustles in the darkness, or sends a rock clattering down the slopes to startle the unwary.

node.name: On the Mountainside, The Crevice
node.description: Seismic force has sundered the mountain, splitting the summit to leave behind a vast crevasse. Pine trees, gnarled and stunted at this altitude, grow in scattered clumps with fallen trunks littering the area.

node.name: Mountainside, Thin Path
node.description: The path thins here between a line of boulders on one side and trees and shrubs against the mountainside. On a ledge overhead, the scattered pieces of a long-abandoned nest are decorated with feathers caught on the bark. Just out of reach, a cracked egg shell rocks with any errant breeze.
The path thins here between a line of boulders on one side and trees and shrubs against the mountainside. Occasionally an eerie scratching noise from the ledge above follows an errant breeze.

node.name: Mountainside, The Ledge
node.description: The path ends abruptly on a ledge of crystalline stone that overlooks the canyons and lakes far below. Across the expansive vista, the majestic Himineldar Shel -- peaks occasionally wreathed in clouds -- are visible in the distance.

node.name: In the Mountain, The Crevice
node.description: Instead of the expected close walls of a crevice, the area opens up into a large crater that is not detectable from outside the pine-covered entrance. Large boulders lie about everywhere and trees grow thick along the sides, protected from the weather. The path forks, each direction well traveled, possibly by the wild animals that come here for shelter.

Instead of the expected close walls of a crevice, the area opens up into a large crater that is not detectable from outside the pine-covered entrance. The shapes of large boulders and trees growing along the sides can be made out in the darkness. The path forks, each direction well traveled, possibly by the wild animals that come here for shelter.

node.name: In the Mountain, The Bone Yard
node.description: A large ledge overhangs what has clearly been used as a bone yard by the occupants of this crater. Most piles are haphazardly arranged with no order, though the rim of the ledge has been carefully lined with a row of grinning skulls that range in size from field mouse to mammoth. The path winds to the northeast through this macabre setting.

node.name: In the Crater, Kitchen
node.description: In the center of this cleared area is an enormous fire pit that is aflame even though no caretakers are visible. Filled with a grey bubbling concoction, a grey mammoth skull lies on a pile of stones in the flames. To one side of the fire pit, a pile of raw half-gnawed animal legs and rib cages rests, for those that can't wait for the stew to be ready.

node.name: In the Crater, Communal Area
node.description: Clearly composed of broken pieces of caravans and wagons, a large, disorganized semicircle of debris occupies the center of the area. One oddly decorated caravan remains mostly intact, placed by itself beneath a small ledge. Dark red and brown stains have soaked into the ground in the cleared area inside the crescent of rubbish.

Clearly composed of broken pieces of caravans and wagons, a large, disorganized semicircle of debris occupies the center of the area. One oddly decorated caravan remains mostly intact, placed by itself beneath a small ledge. Darkened areas on the ground are in the cleared area inside the circle.

node.name: In the Crater, Sleeping Area
node.description: Occupants are sheltered from the weather by the ledge overhanging this flattened area. Enormous piles of untanned skins litter the ground, all in various states of decay. A smoothed slab has been placed at the end of each pile, grimy with grease and stains. The stench is almost unbearable as the soft murmur of flies fill the air.

Occupants are sheltered from the weather by the ledge overhanging this flattened area. Enormous piles littering the ground can be made out in the darkness. The stench is almost unbearable as the rustle of small creatures can be heard from unknown sources.

node.name: In the Crater, The Pit
node.description: Moving around a line of pine trees, the rise in the ground prevents falling into the deep pit that fills the whole area. A ledge overhangs the pit, allowing light to penetrate but still protecting it from weather. The path follows the edge to the northwest, any other way blocked by the pit or large boulders.

Moving around a line of pine trees, the rise in the ground prevents falling into the deep pit that fills the whole area. A ledge overhangs the pit, allowing any available light to penetrate but still protecting it from weather. The only passable path seems to be to the northwest, as other ways are blocked by looming obstacles in the darkness.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Storage Area
node.description: This area was once a staging area of the old mine. Now broken bottles, piles of debris and rotting food litters the floor and surrounds a small fire pit.

This area was once a staging area of the old mine. Meticulously carved sandstone tiles form a decorative veneer over the walls' crumbling mortar, hinting at former prosperity and natural artisanship. Now, broken bottles, piles of debris and rotting food litter the floor surrounding a small fire pit. To the south, ambient light from the entrance fades into murky grey shadows.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Storage Area
node.description: Away from the uncertain light of the entrance, the walls are slick with greasy mold leaving the room dank and musty-smelling. Shadows lurk along the corners, masking the progressive state of decay and the ragged gaps in the sandstone veneer. Glittering glass shards cover the floor, fanning away from a ruined cupboard. Keeping vigil beside the mine's door is a kneeling figure, its outstretched hands holding a black marble slab upon which to rest an offering.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Tunnel
node.description: The caliginous light makes it difficult to see far. Broad timber struts partition the crumbling sedimentary walls and shore up the low ceiling joists. One strut bears a blackened halo above a corroding metal bracket where the miners placed their torches. Thick wooden beams, or track ties, lock a pair of pitted steel ridges into place as they disappear around a sharp curve into the shadows.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Tunnel
node.description: Following the bend, the old tracks continue through a square arch of splintered timbers, disappearing beneath a formidable mound of rubble. The relic of an old rock fall, the tumbled stones and dirt make passage through the arch a tight squeeze. A derelict mining cart, its wheels rusted tight, lies overturned below a torch bracket that hangs precariously by a corroded bolt.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Sloping Tunnel
node.description: An old lantern emits a faint glow to hold the suffocating darkness at bay. The large hill of rubble and gravel peters out into sludge the consistency of porridge that sticks to boots, clothing, and skin, and makes the going quite difficult. The tracks extend from a pile of rubble that partially blocks the arch to the north, only to drop away down a steep slope.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Sloping Tunnel
node.description: The damp and darkness have taken their toll on the wooden ties below the iron tracks, fostering a home for borers and beetles in the dark, crumbling wood. Thankfully, the tracks have long ceased to need the ties and continue to mimic the dips and curves of the slope. Debris of old washouts, roots, rocks and gravel caught between the tracks and sleepers makes the way perilous for the hasty. The danger for travelers is somewhat alleviated by a rusted handrail loosely bolted into the fragmenting rock wall.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Rock Shelf
node.description: The tracks emerge from a declivitous tunnel onto this broad sandstone shelf before again disappearing down the slope of a wide, dark hole. The spluttering light of a solitary lantern dimly catches the sumptuous colors of limestone shawls, delicately stained by mineral deposits. Overhead, cracks in the ceiling continuously bleed drops of lime-rich water that fall with a plop around the hole, wearing away at the rock to form a smooth set of shallow pockmarks.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Rock Ledge
node.description: The slopes of a dark hole pierce the broad shelf above this narrow ledge. Beyond the crumbling edge, vaulted cavern ceilings soar and staggering canyon depths plummet into shadowed depths, a vast emptiness surrounded by glory. Magnificent limestone shawls drape the walls in multicolored splendor, twinkling as faceted crystals reflect the dim light. The rust-laden tracks lie forlorn and forgotten veering off to the east, a dreary contrast to the resplendent backdrop.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Cavern
node.description: In the dim light, the tracks are barely visible, hugging a jagged bend in the rock shelf's wall before they turn east onto a long, narrow bridge suspended from two immense wooden girders. The workmanship of the aerial walkway speaks of experienced engineers, although the materials seem somewhat primitive. Leading off to the northeast a rotting platform depends from a network of wrist-thick wires.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Bridge
node.description: Massive ropes, spliced and bound with steel wire, are pulled taut against the girders to support the weight of the bridge. Between the steel wire and the rotting slats, zigzagged ropes reinforce the handhold and border the aerial walkway.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Bridge
node.description: An ever-present air current from the chasm below causes the bridge to sway gently from side to side, sending small trickles of dust down between the wood to dissipate in mid-air. The ropes creak and protest at the added stress and only the steel cable reinforcing the fist-thick rope serves as reassurance that the bridge will indeed not snap and break.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Bridge
node.description: The wooden planks stop short at a hole. Damp air, borers and age have won their battle with the bridge, leaving behind a gaping hole that offers a wide view of the chasm below. The far side of the breach is shrouded in darkness, with only vague shapes being visible from here.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Rotting Platform
node.description: Suspended by rotting cable fixtures overhead, the platform bounces gently as air currents swirl, and the cable dips a little lower over the plummeting depths of the chasm. It is not obvious why this platform is here but vacant cable fixtures seem to indicate aborted plans to extend it.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Rotting Platform
node.description: Tiny particles of dust continually drift down from the fittings. Some are heavy enough to settle on and between the planks, eventually sifting away into the blackness below. Others float away idly like tiny twinkling motes in the air. To the south, you can see the long bridge, but the gap between this platform and the bridge is widening.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Rotting Platform
node.description: Supported by a rickety, makeshift trestle connecting it to a bridge, the platform comes to an abrupt end here. Creaking timbers and shifting debris mingle with the high-pitched squeals of bats, sending echoes whispering through the sepulchral chasm.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Bridge
node.description: Rotting timbers tumble over the edge of a gaping hole, held to the bridge by fraying ropes. Reinforced beams stand sentinel at the ledge, though cut marks mar their steel surface and most of the cables which once supported the bridge have long since snapped, leaving behind only a few strands. Fallen rocks and other rubble litter the remaining planks, the debris growing denser to the east.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Cave-in
node.description: A mountainous cave-in has spewed huge rocks and tons of rubble toward the bridge, and blocks the way further east. Curiously, a set of deep wheel ruts carve their way through the silted ground and stop abruptly at an enormous boulder.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Fractured Ledge
node.description: Careless mining practices have left the walls without reinforcement, resulting in rock falls that litter the ledge with mounds of rubble. From time to time, a loose stone will clatter down the pile before tumbling over the edge into the abyss, leaving behind an expectant silence as you wait in vain to hear it strike the bottom. A rope tied to an iron stake dangles over the precipice.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Hollow
node.description: A cramped dugout has been carved into the crumbling cliff face, probably the handiwork of an exploration team. A long rope suspended from an overhead spike swings gently from side to side, brushing against a ledge and fraying the fibers. Below the hollow, the rope ends at a small wooden platform dangling precariously into the mouth of a yawning abyss.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Wooden Platform
node.description: This small platform hangs suspended a short way into the abyss, the old rope tied securely to the metal framework. Although here the rope and frame are still in good order, the timber slats are beginning to rot. Gaps in the flooring show only a sheer vertical cliff face shrouded in darkness.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Vertical Cliff Face
node.description: A soft phosphorescent glow emanates from huge patches of fungus that coat the rocky outcrops jutting from the walls of this sheer cliff face. Even so, the surroundings are difficult to make out in the low light. All that is readily visible are shallow handholds in the immediate vicinity that appear like daubs of shadow pocking the luminous fungi.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Vertical Cliff Face
node.description: The darkness is only slightly ameliorated by the soft phosphorescent glow emanating from huge patches of fungus that coat the rock walls of this narrow crevice, making it difficult to fully discern the surroundings.

node.name: Abandoned Mine, Chasm Floor
node.description: Huge patches of phosphorescent moss cling to the slick sides of the creviced wall, lending a ghostly glow to the surrounds. The ground is smooth and dusty, littered with tiny bits of gravel that have fallen from above. An occasional drip plops into a body of water nearby and the sound echoes eerily before the deep hush settles once more.

node.name: Underground Lake, Shoreline
node.description: The ground gradually slopes down, dipping below the surface of a murky lake. Thick, phosphorescent fungus sprouts out of crevices in the cave wall, grasping out for moisture dripping down the stone. Small ripples in the lake refract the pale light, causing an effect similar to moonlight dancing off the water. Something can be heard dripping into the lake from further into darkness to the east.

node.name: Underground Lake, Shallows
node.description: The chilly water in the shallows of this subterranean lake is crystal clear, showing the silted bottom. It looks only knee deep. Drops of condensation occasionally plummet from somewhere unseen, far up above. A large rock rises up out of the water to the east, making straight travel impossible. The lake stretches out to the southeast, around the rock while the gravelly floor rises up to the west.

node.name: Underground Lake
node.description: The water here laps carefully against the massive boulder to the north. Spotted, glowing fungus has taken up resident on the edge of the rock, casting a sickly pallor across the water. The ethereal light dances on top of the lake, but makes it impossible to see what lies below the surface. Water drips steadily into the water from walls which are slick with condensation. The cool water continues its path northeast and northwest around the rock.

node.name: Underground Lake
node.description: The lake casually winds north alongside the protruding rock to the west. Another boulder rises up from the inky depths to the east, not quite breaking the surface of the water. Slick layers of moss have coated both rocks, swaying slowly in the lake's gentle current. The water is so deep here that what lies below cannot be seen through the murk. Trickling water can be heard coming from beyond the eastern boulder.

node.name: Underground Lake
node.description: The lake dead ends here in a stagnant pool pushed up against a solid wall of huge stalactites and fallen boulders to the north. The water is warm due to the lack of circulation, but the amount of moss and algae on the walls have increased greatly. Chunks of finger-like fungus have drifted to the surface of the water here and the air is rich with the stench of rotting plant matter. Cooler water can be felt drifting in from the south, but it has little effect on the overall temperature.

node.name: Underground Lake, Rocky Shore
node.description: This false shore is formed by a low rock shelf, the floor not quite rising above the surface of the lake. As the water laps up against the shelf wall, it trickles into a large chute which has been naturally formed to the east. A few deep gouges mar the rock walls, many of which have been turned into shelters for a spongy type of fungus. The ground drops away to the west into the gloomy lake.

node.name: Abandoned Tunnel, Sludge Pit
node.description: The smell of stagnant mud is heavy in the air here and the ground has the consistency of old porridge. Standing water mixed with fine dirt rests atop a treacherous bottom of thick mud, making movement in this area difficult. Water occasionally drips into the mixture from the hole that rests high on the western wall. Some shoring begins to the northwest and the ground appears to gain some semblance of structure.

node.name: Abandoned Tunnels, Dead End
node.description: The soil is almost too soft to support a body's weight. Apparently, those who excavated this tunnel realized the futility and stopped a little southeast of here. Far to the west is the remnant of a last attempt at shoring the walls, and in all other directions, the floor gently slopes upwards. While the slope seems innocuous, a brief test would reveal that the soil is only slightly more firm than mud. The deceptive slope mocks any attempts to climb up and jealously guards the secret of what lies beyond

The soil is almost too soft to support a body's weight. Apparently, those who excavated this tunnel realized the futility and stopped a little southeast of here. Far to the west is the remnant of a last attempt at shoring the walls, and in all other directions, the floor gently slopes upwards. While the slope seems innocuous, a brief test would reveal that the soil is only slightly more firm than mud. The deceptive slope mocks any attempts to climb up and jealously guards the secret of what lies beyond.

node.name: Abandoned Tunnels, Eastern Corridor
node.description: The walls gradually widen until there is no need to brace them for comfortable walking. Heavy moisture in the air has penetrated the soil, causing it to be soft and formless. Some failed remains of an attempt to hold the saturated walls back is barely discernable, most of the structure having rotted away. Three metal bands and a pile of decaying wood appear to be all that is left of some sort of barrel, whose original contents one might only guess at.

node.name: Abandoned Tunnels, Eastern Corridor
node.description: As the corridor continues, the damp smell is unavoidable and much stronger. The wooden wall braces steadily become more frequent presumably to defend against the lack of consistency in the soil, which appears to have sloughed off after years of neglect. Partly obscured by decades of accumulated dust, the imprints of boots are still faintly visible on the floor.

node.name: Abandoned Tunnels, Eastern Corridor
node.description: The faint smell of lingering mold and a heaviness in the air both betray the presence of moisture in this roughly-hewn corridor. The rotting remains of wooden braces line the walls, occasionally bearing a blackened hole ideal for holding a torch or lantern hook.

node.name: Abandoned Tunnels, Crevice
node.description: The floor of this crevice would dead end to the west at the foot of a towering rock shelf if not for the beginnings of a tunnel carved into its base. Wooden supports and miscellaneous debris can be seen further west in the tunnel, while the crevice path continues to the east. The walls of this chasm fade into nothingness above you as a vast expanse of shadow ceilings the cavern, the faint but consistent sound of dripping the only answer to your gaze. To the north is a low opening.

node.name: Abandoned Tunnels, Staging Area
node.description: A low opening expands into this broad cave. While hardly a home away from home, it looks like this was used as a meeting room for a team that came some time before the tunnel's construction began. A few aging wooden chairs surround a fallen table, all resting atop a tattered hemp rug. A rusted iron lantern depends above the sitting area, providing awkward lighting at best. Scraps of cloth, torn-out pages, and frayed rope-ends show that many preparations were executed here.

node.name: Abandoned Tunnels, Storage Area
node.description: Long abandoned and stripped of anything useful, this room still retains the notable odor of steel and weapon oil. On the western wall leans a warped cabinet, its door hanging from one rusty hinge. On the eastern wall hang various iron racks, suited for holding weapons and armor while keeping them readily available for use. Dark oil stains pattern the floor. Large barrels and boxes lie discarded some even smashed, in a corner of the room, obvious remnants of depleted food stores.

node.name: In The Cabinet, A Prayer Niche
node.description: Amidst the decay, a broken panel guards this small prayer niche like a drunken sentinel. Even so, there is a hush here reminiscent of a holy place. Two iron sconces hold dusty candles that have long ago burned down, leaving beaded streams of milky wax to sink to the floor in lacy strands. Further back in this peaceful nook sits a tumbledown altar, covered in similarly exhausted candles, and there at its feet, between two candle stubs rests a worn, leather-bound journal.

node.name: Abandoned Tunnels, Western Branch
node.description: All sounds become short and claustrophobic, losing the familiar echo as the walls close in. Heavy, but aging wooden structural supports line walls of this section of the tunnel, holding back the immense pressure of the rock shelf surrounding it. Various mining tools, now worthless, lay scattered haphazardly about the area, a hint at the flurry of activity this tunnel may once have seen. To the east, a seemingly roofless chasm opens up, as the cramped mining tunnel plunges on to the west.

node.name: Abandoned Tunnels, Western Branch
node.description: Pebbles skitter down the tunnel dislodged by the slightest movement of air. Rocks jut out of the sides of the tunnel, scraps of rotting cloth caught from some unwary passerby. Many of the sturdy supports are soot stained, marking the locations of torches long since expired. To the southwest, the tunnel continues downward, while higher ground is to the east. At the side of the corridor, a patch of burlap is half-buried by a small cave-in.

node.name: Abandoned Tunnels, Western Branch
node.description: A large crack runs perpendicularly through this part of the tunnel. The strong timbers are heavily reinforced in order to compensate for the structural weaknesses that the crack implies. While narrow at the floor, the crack's width at the ceiling looks almost large enough to fit a gnome. The gap in the floor is filled with rocks and dirt to make a smooth passage across, but the filling seems to be blotchily discolored.

node.name: Abandoned Tunnels, Western Branch
node.description: The tunnel continues west with its uniform look of sturdy support beams and messy mining leftovers strewn about in a hasty fashion. Every noise seems to fall short, causing the tunnel to feel unnaturally cramped. The darkness that closes in on the tunnel from east and west makes it seem possible that it continues on forever into the rock. Slightly off the middle of the walkway lies a half-buried bird cage.

node.name: Abandoned Tunnels, Western Branch
node.description: The passageway stretches on to the east and west with no end in sight. The vastness makes time feel dilated, presumably affected by the absence of significant differences in the surrounding environment. Even the rocks sent tumbling by any footstep seem to skitter to an abrupt halt, providing no alleviation to the seemingly endless repetition of the deserted tunnels.

node.name: Abandoned Tunnels, Western Branch
node.description: A brilliant quartz vein surfaces in the wall here, glowing from some unknown phosphorescence. Deep within the vein, there are dark spots presumably indicating the presence of a denser mineral. Someone in search of the hoped-for gold or perhaps trying to get to the dark spots within has gouged out a large chunk of the quartz, damaging the natural splendor of the vein and littering the floor with the off cuts.

node.name: Abandoned Tunnels, Ledge
node.description: The tunnel comes to an abrupt westward end, as a rockslide has collapsed a good portion of the floor. The only way to continue on the path west is down a steep cliff of fallen rocks mixed with the splintered remains of some support beams. Attached to a sturdy rock at the edge of the ledge is a steel cable, which hangs stiffly down the side of the low cliff.

node.name: Abandoned Tunnels, Rockslide
node.description: Snaking its way amongst the litter of the rockslide is the steel cable that hangs from the ledge above. Small rocks and skittering pebbles make getting a foothold difficult and the way uncertain. To the southeast, resting on some rocks is a massive split girder arrested in its downward descent. There perched rather forlornly is an old decaying boot lying on its side, either discarded by some unfortunate or perhaps ripped off their foot.

node.name: Abandoned Tunnels, Rockslide
node.description: The precariously lodged girder cuts off here, its savagely splintered end hanging in mid air. That might have been the end of the journey, were it not for two solid metal pins driven into a boulder. Suspended from this surprising discovery is a rope ladder that hangs down the slope.

node.name: Abandoned Tunnels, Old Camp
node.description: Rubble surrounds a long-expired fire pit. Ever-higher piles of rocks to the west block the way forward. Short of excavation, there is no way to go further. To the east is a high rock wall that looks very difficult to climb except for the rope ladder that provides a way out. Years of non-use have worn down what may have once been a makeshift camp. A few discarded ration wrappers lie decaying between and under two large stones.

node.name: Abandoned Tunnels, Way out
node.description: It is obvious that this was an initial excavation site some time ago. Mining tools that have been worn down to the nub lie scattered about this wide tunnel, while sturdy wooden shoring lines the rough stone walls. Oddly, a substantial-looking axe handle with a rope tied to it has been wedged in between two rocks near a rocky ledge. The northern wall has been dug away to reveal a large hole, causing a brisk mountain wind to whistle through the hallway.

node.name: Himineldar Shel, Ice Cavern
node.description: The weather outside suddenly seems beneficent. Once the frigid wind enters this cavern, whether howling through the cave mouth or swooping in a hole in the mountainside, it gets trapped and gains power as it spirals between gaps in the cavern floors, walls and ceilings. Each gust spreads a damp, brittle cold that chills even through the thickest armor while appearing to caress a variety of ice formations. Depth perception is erratic as ice walls almost act like mirrors, reflecting what may not be there.

node.name: Himineldar Shel, Ice Cavern
node.description: A slight slope to the ice floor results in a slipping hazard that has been somewhat alleviated by battles fought in the area. Constant melting and refreezing has mercifully ruined the smoothness of the cave floor, barely visible in some spots under clouded ice protrusions. Gouges and ruts in the ice allow for last minute balance corrections, saving many a sore behind.

Gouges and ruts in the ice allow for last minute balance corrections, saving many a sore behind.

node.name: Himineldar Shel, Ice Cavern
node.description: Slippery tunnels, narrowed by ice, seem to twist and turn in no ordered direction. A huge stalagmite forming here hampers progress even further. Slick deposits of lime and frost coat the floor so thickly that in places only the most agile can safely pass between it and the ceiling.

node.name: Himineldar Shel, Ice Cavern
node.description: Frigid air stiffens anything warm-blooded and makes navigating the slippery cave more treacherous. The thick ice encasing an extremely narrow passageway to the northeast seems pearlized, as if it was exposed to outside light. Close inspection of some dark spots in the floor reveals rusted items trapped in the ice.

node.name: Himineldar Shel, Ice Cavern
node.description: Claustrophobia easily affects those susceptible, as perspective in here is skewed: the floor slopes slightly upward while the ceiling seems to plunge suddenly, looming just above a Gor'Tog's head. Protrusions of thicker ice along the tunnel-like walls narrow the passageway further.

node.name: Himineldar Shel, Ice Cavern
node.description: Shards of ice litter the floor and crunch into tiny crystals under foot. A few strands of matted hair are half frozen into the floor. Puddles of water covered in a frigid glaze mask what lies beneath, increasing the challenge of choosing safe footing. The slick walls act like mirrors, reflecting what may not be there.

node.name: Himineldar Shel, Ice Cavern
node.description: Winds come from all directions, sighing noisily as they change course inside the cavern. Capriciously spewed snowflakes and ice crystals swirl through the holes in the floors and whip around the glacial impediments. Situated in their path, one polished pillar of ice reflects ghost passages, further confusing movement.

node.name: Himineldar Shel, Ice Cavern
node.description: Already precarious, travel through this section is complicated by a gaping hole in the dead center of the floor. A ragged ledge of frozen ice to the east appears solid enough to withstand some weight, enabling passage to another area over a corner of the precipice.

node.name: Himineldar Shel, Ice Cavern
node.description: The ceiling is caked with ice that has seeped through the mountain into this cavern. Several varied and unusual frozen sculptures appear to be the result of a fast defrost and a slow refreeze. The solid wall directly ahead is coated in a frozen glaze that resembles a fast flowing vertical river.

The ceiling is caked with ice that has seeped through the mountain into this cavern. Several varied and unusual frozen sculptures appear to be the result of a fast defrost and a slow refreeze. The solid wall directly ahead is coated in a frozen glaze that resembles a fast flowing vertical river.

node.name: Himineldar Shel, Ice Cavern
node.description: Thick frozen spires jut up from the slick floor, never quite meeting those that hang down from the roof of the cavern but coming close enough to force a change of direction. Gaping holes in the cave floor plunge into inky depths below the frost line causing passage through the area to be slow and careful. In some spots, newly formed ice tentatively creeps over old holes, but counting on its ability to hold weight is for the foolhardy.

node.name: Momma's Bed and Breakfast, Foyer
node.description: This large foyer looks the same as when it was used as a home by the family. A small table holding a wide ledger that is propped open sits beside a high-backed bench. Beside the door is a basket half-filled with muddy shoes and boots. Through a darkened doorway, stairs leading downwards can be seen. Large entries to the east and west lead into the actual living quarters.

node.name: Momma's Bed and Breakfast, Parlor
node.description: Low ceilings and darkened wall panels in this room make candles necessary throughout the night and day. Everything is very tidy right down to the pine floor that has recently been swept. Mismatched armchairs and stools have been arranged in an attempt to provide private seating areas. Hung in a place of honor over the mantel of the fieldstone fireplace is a broken axe handle.

node.name: Momma's Bed and Breakfast, Hallway
node.description: A brown runner goes the length of the hallway. Embroidered flowers in plain pine frames are mounted on the walls between the doorframes. Small tables sit to the right of the doors, a water pitcher and chamberpot resting on a lace doily atop each one.

node.name: Momma's Bed and Breakfast, Dining Room
node.description: Filling most of the room, a thick pine dining table with benches on each length always has place settings. Made from cast iron, a stove in the corner has a large pot simmering on the back. Swinging doors at the end of the room must lead to the kitchen, evidenced by the wear and tear on the floor. A pine sideboard has been pushed into the corner opposite the stove.

node.name: Momma's Bed and Breakfast, The Kitchen
node.description: Overly large, the stove has pots bubbling away on top and the smell of fresh baked bread fills the air. A pie safe with punched tin doors faces a long counter piled high with cleaned plates. Sitting next to the back door, a wood bin is filled to the top with roughly split logs. Bundles of fresh herbs hang to dry from the low rafters, adding to the odors of the constant cooking.

node.name: Momma's Bed and Breakfast, Back Yard
node.description: A glow through the back door shows rocking chairs that have been set up under the extended eaves off the back of the house. From the darkness, the occasional squawk of a chicken alarmed by something in the night can be heard. The shape of a well can be seen in the middle of the yard.

node.name: Momma's Bed and Breakfast, Momma's Room
node.description: What was clearly once a root cellar from the lingering earthly odor is now a small bedroom. Pristine in its tidiness, the room is uncluttered by anything fancy. Spartan to an extreme, a sleigh bed with a faded quilt and a pine dresser are the only pieces of furniture. A small woven rug sits beside the bed where Momma must swing her feet out every morning.

node.name: Momma's Bed and Breakfast, Side Room
node.description: Neatly mended lace curtains have been pulled closed. A soft blue quilt has been drawn up over the pillow on the single bed. Polished pine, used in the building of the dresser and nightstand, matches the bed's wood. The floor is immaculate and the white rag rug has been well beaten.

node.name: Momma's Bed and Breakfast, Dormitory
node.description: This room was clearly added onto the home in later years as evidenced by the newer wall panels and floor. What must have been the master bedroom has been turned into a dormitory of bunk beds with little room between them to put anything. A locker sits at the end of each row, a neatly folded towel and cloth on the top of each one.

node.name: Momma's Bed and Breakfast, Guest Room
node.description: A sparkling white goose-down comforter and soft, plush pillows with embroidered slips adorn this high post bed. Fresh flowers in a porcelain vase sit upon a dressing table. Finishing off the furnishings of this room is an armoire with carving on the doors that almost seems out of place with the rest of the inn.

node.name: The Chapel of Raven's Point
node.description: In stark contrast to the hovels that fill the walls of Raven's Point, the interior of the chapel is adorned with rare gems and metals gathered from the four corners of Forfedhdar. A massive raven, carved from black stone streaked with glittering veins of gold, dominates the rear of the church, its talons curling tightly around the edges of the altar and holding it aloft. Halos of lingering incense hover above the burning candles that line the foot of the exterior walls, fending off the pressing darkness.

Halos of lingering incense hover above the burning candles that line the foot of the exterior walls, fending off the pressing darkness.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, Gear Gate
node.description: Rough-cut logs with sharpened peaks reach across the rough stone walls to block further passage though the pass to the north. Thick curls of black smoke spiral into the sky from beyond the makeshift walls of the outpost, the air filled with the pungent aroma of blood sausage and smoking cedar. In the direct center of the fortification, a massive gear gate has been sandwiched between the sharpened log walls, reaching across the valley to slide seamlessly into the black rock walls of the valley.

node.name: The Raven's Nest, Commander's Office
node.description: The elongated office has been hung with numerous parchment maps displaying the treacherous roadways of the Seord Kerwaith, but drawn and painted from various angles and declinations. A roaring fireplace fills the office with its warming glow, assisted by several braziers hung along the walls. A golden eagle rests on a scratched stand resting next the commander's desk, blinking lazily as it casually observes the area with its dull orange eyes.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, A High Ledge
node.description: From this vantage point, high above the trail below, the view would be spectacular -- if only the constantly wind-whipped snow would clear long enough to allow a good look. The mountain rises with a sheer slope, curving slightly overhead so that this ledge is somewhat protected, but also preventing any possible climb further. The ledge itself is wide enough for comfort standing, but not so wide that one is tempted to remain for any length of time.

node.name: Seord Kerwaith, A Soaring Precipice
node.description: Rising high above the valley, the narrow ledge terminates at the top of the sheer cliff face. The vertical drop from the precipice is obscured by wind-blown clouds of icy particles. Although partially hidden by drifting clouds of snow and ice, a distant tower of grim black stone rises between two mountain peaks.

node.name: Smoky Bandit's, Hideaway
node.description: Stacks of crates are piled high in this small underground room, though it's clear that this cellar is meant for more than just storage. A rack of weapons with a battered shield resting against it sits near a blazing torch, and close by is a small shelf stacked with preserved foodstuffs. In the far corner is a heap of thick fur blankets ready to defend against the cold. A sturdy ladder leads up to a trapdoor in the ceiling.
